name: YLLW FACTORY
description: Sweden's leading B2B furniture reuse specialist with 65,000+ items in inventory and comprehensive refurbishment services. Growing at 30% annually, demonstrating strong market position and reliability. Operates a dedicated refurbishment factory in Dalby with proven hospitality market expertise including hotels and restaurants. Provides full-service solutions from sourcing to installation with industry-leading 3-year warranties.
location: Primary warehouse and refurbishment factory in Dalby, Sk√•ne. Secondary warehouse in J√∂nk√∂ping. Sales office in Stockholm. Nationwide coverage across Sweden.
services: Fire safety testing coordination via RISE/SP

capabilities.volume: 65,000+ items in inventory with capacity for multiple simultaneous large hotel projects. Historically accumulated 30,000 chairs, demonstrating exceptional volume capability. Can handle 100-200 room hotel renovations.
capabilities.leadTime: Stock items: 1-3 weeks. Custom sourcing projects: 6-12 weeks. Refurbishment services add 3-6 weeks. Volume orders: 4-8 weeks for accumulation and quality control.
capabilities.inventory: Largest B2B furniture inventory in Sweden. Strong focus on office chairs, desks, storage, sofas, lounge furniture. Restaurant and caf√© furniture available. Critical gap: hotel bed frames not currently stocked.
capabilities.logistics: Nationwide Swedish delivery. Stockholm sales office provides rapid metropolitan coverage. Full installation services with professional project management. Nordic coverage possible but requires verification.

metadata.criticalNote: üö® CRITICAL CATEGORY DISTINCTION: MATER DESIGN MANUFACTURES BRAND-NEW FURNITURE FROM RECYCLED MATERIALS. They are NOT a reuse/second-hand furniture operator. This is a completely different category: (1) Reuse operators (YLLW, Input, Rekomo) = buy existing used furniture and resell it. (2) Mater Design = manufactures new furniture from recycled material inputs (ocean plastic, coffee waste). Relevant ONLY if client circular economy strategy accepts new furniture made from recycled content. NOT relevant if requirement is actual reused/second-hand furniture. Clarify client expectations before recommending.
